meanings.definition: To take the place of (someone or something previously in authority or use)
meanings.sent1: A new king supersedes the old ruler.
meanings.sent3: The young prince supersedes the old king in a game of chess.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun supersedes the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent5: The fresh coat of paint supersedes the old, peeling one on the wall.

meanings.definition: To replace (something older or less effective)
meanings.sent1: The digital clock supersedes the old analog one.
meanings.sent2: New software updates frequently supersedes the previous versions.
meanings.sent3: The new superhero comic book supersedes the popularity of the old series.
meanings.sent4: The vibrant colors of spring supersedes the dullness of winter.
meanings.sent5: The modern smartphone supersedes the functionality of the old flip phone.
